content: ws across the decrease gap followed by either k1 or p1 as you were knitting previously then turn your work continue repeating these row until all the stitches have been used ending on a ws row turn your work to the right side you should now be left with 20 heel stitches creating the gusset and gusset decreases change to mc 𓋼𓍊 k10 place marker bor k10 your bor marker should be in the middle of the 20 heel stitches 𓋼𓍊 pick up and k16 sts down the side of the heel flap 𓋼𓍊 pick up and knit one more stitch at the corner to help fill and prevent the dreaded heel corner hole place marker 𓋼𓍊 k32 across the instep place marker 𓋼𓍊 pick up and knit one stitch in the corner 𓋼𓍊 pick up and k16 sts up the side of the heel flap 𓋼𓍊 k10 to reach bor you should now have 84 stitches and will now be knitting in the round the additional 2 markers are added to help you keep track of the gusset decrease placement feel free to omit these pg 4 pattern copyright sophie skinner 2022 for personal use only gusset decreases the next 2 row will be repeated to decrease the gusset continue repeating until you have 64 sts remaining 𓋼𓍊 k until 3 sts before the marker k2tog k1 slip marker k32 slip marker k1 ssk k to bor 𓋼𓍊 k entire row you should now have 64 sts foot knit in the round until you reach 6cm 2 4 approximately from the desired finished sock length removing the gusset decrease stitch markers as you get to them 𓋼𓍊 increase row *k8 inc1* 8 times you will now have 72 sts 𓋼𓍊 work chart 2 from bottom to top right to left repeat each chart row 12 times until reaching bor before moving on to the next add contrast colours as you go and cut all contrast colours after finishing the chart remember to leave long enough ends to weave in 𓋼𓍊 decrease row *k7 k2tog* 8 times you will now have 64 sts 𓋼𓍊 k one row toe work the toe in cc1 you may find it easier to work on dpns however i usually continue with magic loop method count 16 stitches away from the bor on either side place markers at these points these will help you keep track of your decreases your bor will be in the middle of the underside of your sock 𓋼𓍊 decrease row k until 3sts from marker k2tog k1 slip marker k1 ssk k until 3 sts from marker k2tog k1 slip marker k1 ssk k until bor 𓋼𓍊 k one row repeat these two row until you have 40 sts remaining continue knitting only the decrease row until you have 20 stitches remaining divide your stitches onto two needles 10 stitches on each using the stitch markers as the division points the stitch markers show the start and end of each
